00054 fsal_status_t FSAL_readlink(
00055     fsal_handle_t         * linkhandle,       /* IN */
00056     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,                     /* IN */
00057     fsal_path_t           * p_link_content,     /* OUT */
00058     fsal_attrib_list_t    * link_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00059 ){
00060 
00061   int rc;
00062   fsal_status_t st;
00063   char link_content_out[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00064   
00065  /* sanity checks.
00066   * note : link_attributes is optional.
00067   */
00068   if (!linkhandle || !p_context || !p_link_content)
00069     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00070     
00071   
00072   /* call to the API */
00073   
00074   TakeTokenFSCall();
00075   
00076   rc = hpss_ReadlinkHandle(
00077     &(linkhandle->ns_handle),       /* IN - Handle of symbolic link */
00078     NULL,                           /* IN - Path of the link (null=>ignored) */
00079     link_content_out,               /* OUT - contents of the link */
00080     FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,              /* IN - Size, in bytes, of contents buffer */
00081     &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred ); /* IN - pointer to user credentials */
00082 
00083   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00084   
00085   /* /!\ rc is the length for the symlink content !!! */
00086   
00087   /* The HPSS_ENOENT error actually means that handle is STALE */
00088   if ( rc == HPSS_ENOENT )
00089     Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00090   else if ( rc < 0 )
00091     Return( hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00092   
00093     
00094   /* convert char * to fsal_path_t */
00095   
00096   st = FSAL_str2path(link_content_out,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,p_link_content);
00097   
00098   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00099     Return(st.major, st.minor,INDEX_FSAL_readlink);
00100     
00101   
00102   /* retrieves object attributes, if asked */
00103   
00104   if ( link_attributes ){
00105     
00106     fsal_status_t status;
00107     
00108     status = FSAL_getattrs( linkhandle, p_context , link_attributes );
00109     
00110     /* On error, we set a flag in the returned attributes */
00111     
00112     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00113     {
00114       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00115       FSAL_SET_MASK( link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00116           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00117     }
00118     
00119   }
00120   
00121   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_readlink );
00122   
00123   
00124 }

00127 
00162 fsal_status_t FSAL_symlink(
00163     fsal_handle_t         * parent_directory_handle,    /* IN */
00164     fsal_name_t           * p_linkname,                 /* IN */
00165     fsal_path_t           * p_linkcontent,              /* IN */
00166     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,                     /* IN */
00167     fsal_accessmode_t       accessmode,                 /* IN (ignored) */
00168     fsal_handle_t         * link_handle,                /* OUT */
00169     fsal_attrib_list_t    * link_attributes             /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00170 ){
00171 
00172   int rc;
00173   hpss_Attrs_t  attrs;
00174   
00175   /* sanity checks.
00176    * note : link_attributes is optional.
00177    */
00178   if ( !parent_directory_handle || 
00179        !p_context   ||
00180        !link_handle ||
00181        !p_linkname  ||
00182        !p_linkcontent )
00183     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00184   
00185 
00186   /* Tests if symlinking is allowed by configuration. */
00187   
00188   if ( !global_fs_info.symlink_support )
00189       Return( ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP, 0,INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00190 
00191     
00192   /* call to hpss client API. */
00193   
00194   TakeTokenFSCall();
00195   
00196   rc = HPSSFSAL_SymlinkHandle(
00197           &(parent_directory_handle->ns_handle),  /* IN - Handle of existing file */
00198           p_linkcontent->path,    /* IN - Desired contents of the link */
00199           p_linkname->name,       /* IN - New name of the symbolic link */
00200           &(p_context->credential.hpss_usercred), /* IN - pointer to user credentials */
00201           &(link_handle->ns_handle), /* OUT */
00202           &attrs                 /* OUT - symbolic link attributes */
00203        );
00204   
00205   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00206   
00207   /* /!\ WARNING : When the directory handle is stale, HPSS returns ENOTDIR.
00208    * If the returned value is HPSS_ENOTDIR, parent handle MAY be stale.
00209    * Thus, we must double-check by calling getattrs.   
00210    */
00211   if ( rc == HPSS_ENOTDIR || rc == HPSS_ENOENT )
00212   {
00213       if ( HPSSFSAL_IsStaleHandle( &parent_directory_handle->ns_handle,
00214                                    &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred ) )
00215       {
00216         Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_symlink );
00217       }
00218   }
00219   
00220   /* other errors */
00221   if (rc) Return(hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00222   
00223   /* set output handle */
00224   link_handle->obj_type = FSAL_TYPE_LNK;
00225   
00226   
00227   /* get attributes if asked */
00228   
00229   if ( link_attributes ){
00230     
00231     fsal_status_t status;
00232     
00233     status = hpss2fsal_attributes(
00234                      &(link_handle->ns_handle),
00235                      &attrs,
00236                      link_attributes );
00237 
00238     
00239     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00240     {
00241         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( link_attributes->asked_attributes );
00242         FSAL_SET_MASK( link_attributes->asked_attributes,
00243             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00244     }
00245     
00246   }
00247   
00248   
00249   /* OK */
00250   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_symlink);
00251 }
